availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard B. Alexander (Fulton County, KY, farmer and prov govt)

body.p: Fulton County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Elizabeth Alexander. Father of Reed A. L. Alexander and Susan E. Alexander. Farmer in Fulton County in 1860. Owned twenty-three enslaved persons in Fulton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, p. 437.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fulton County, p. 3A.
KYR-0004-033-0001.
Find A Grave, "R. B. Alexander (1801-1868)," Memorial #117439860, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/117439860 (accessed November 19, 2019).
